message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Quick Assets (i.e., current assets excluding inventory):  
• Cash on Hand: 2,105,753.37  
• Bank Deposits: 559,055.66  
• Interest Receivable: 6,494.02  
• Accounts Receivable: 335,639.38  

Total Quick Assets = 2,105,753.37 + 559,055.66 + 6,494.02 + 335,639.38  
          = 3,006,942.43  

Step 2: Identify Total Current Liabilities from the balance sheet:  
Total Current Liabilities = 5,637,910.70  

Step 3: Compute the Quick Ratio:  
Quick Ratio = Total Quick Assets / Total Current Liabilities  
       = 3,006,942.43 / 5,637,910.70  
       ≈ 0.5339  
Rounded to two decimal places, the Quick Ratio is approximately 0.53.

Step 4: Calculate the Net Profit Margin using the income statement:  
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
From the income statement:  
• Net Profit = 99,532.29  
• Total Revenue = 836,813.79  

Net Profit Margin = (99,532.29 / 836,813.79) × 100%  
         ≈ 11.89%

Thus, the final answers in the required format are:

{
  "solution": {
    "Quick Ratio": "0.53", 
    "Net Profit Margin": "11.89%"
  }
}
